GameObjects

Class ShooterEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObjects
      • GameObjects.ShooterEnemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ShooterEnemy
extends GameObjects
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This is the class of shooter enemies who are the ones shooting at the player
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    FarisAlasmary
    See Also:
    GameObjects

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShooterEnemy

        public ShooterEnemy(int xTranslation,
            int yTranslation,
            double angle,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage)
        Constructs the ShooterEnemy object.
        Parameters:
        xTranslation - is the x-coordinate of the object
        yTranslation - is the y-coordinate of the object
        angle - is the rotation angle
        characterImage - is the image that represent the object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage

      • ShooterEnemy

        public ShooterEnemy(java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage)
        Constructs the ShooterEnemy object. This constructor is the most common in use.
        Parameters:
        characterImage - is the image that represent the object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage

      • ShooterEnemy

        public ShooterEnemy(java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage,

        Constructs the ShooterEnemy object.
        Parameters:
        characterImage - is the image that represent the object on the panel
        position - is the position of the object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage OR position

      • getBullets

        public java.util.LinkedList<Bullet> getBullets()
        The getter of the shooter enemy's bullets.
        Returns:
        It returns a reference to a linked list of type "Bullet" which will be used as shooter enemy's bullets.

      • setBullets

        public void setBullets(java.util.LinkedList<Bullet> bullets)
        The setter of the player's bullets.
        Parameters:
        bullets - is a reference to a linked list of type "Bullet" that is going to be used as player's bullets.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no GameObjects object
